title: (x) Soil Behaviour - ITC Zapf Book {Lex}
content:
![](http://web.archive.org/web/20080830000728im_/http:/typophile.com/files/Evgen.jpg)

 [‹ (x) Central Saint Martins poster font - Rockwell {Yves}](http://web.archive.org/web/20080830000728/http:/typophile.com/node/19123 "Go to previous forum topic") [Looking for a digitised version Yagi Universel No.2 (Letraset) ›](http://web.archive.org/web/20080830000728/http:/typophile.com/node/18811 "Go to next forum topic")
author: suntory

comments.content:
Palatino bold?

- Lex

EDIT: Nope, the ’e’ and ’c’ are most definitely wrong. It doesn’t seem to be Melior either. This does look like a Hermann Zapf face though. Maybe it’s one of his own Palatino knock-offs.

I’m thinking this is [ITC Zapf Book Medium](http://web.archive.org/web/20080830000728/http:/www.fontshop.com/index.cfm?fuseaction=catalog.fontdetail&displayfontid=ITC.108295.0.3&attributes.sampleSize=48&sampleText=Geotechnics&sampleSize=48) with a bit of a stroke added.

- Lex
Or Zapf’s Comenius Antiqua strangely blended with Zapf’s Melior

\>\> Zapf Book  
Not exactly, thanks anyway.

I agree with Lex. This is Zapf Book. The Medium weight is a good guess because of the ’t’ being rather clipped-looking on the top. The heavier weights have a funny spike at the top of the ’t’. It’s hard to predict the effect of added stroke thickness unless you try it, but I think Lex got it spot on.

- Mike Yanega
